mountains.name: Mount Everest
mountains.fact: Mount Everest is the highest peak in the world and was first summited by Sir Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay in 1953.

mountains.name: K2 (Mount Godwin-Austen)
mountains.fact: K2 is known as the 'Savage Mountain' due to its challenging climbing conditions and is the second-highest mountain in the world.

mountains.name: Kangchenjunga
mountains.fact: Kangchenjunga was considered the highest mountain in the world until 1852, and it is known for its five peaks.

mountains.name: Lhotse
mountains.fact: Lhotse is closely connected to Everest, sharing the same base camp, and is the fourth-highest mountain in the world.

mountains.name: Makalu
mountains.fact: Makalu is known for its pyramid-shaped peak and is the fifth-highest mountain in the world.

mountains.name: Cho Oyu
mountains.fact: Cho Oyu, meaning 'Turquoise Goddess,' is known for being one of the easiest 8,000-meter peaks to climb.

mountains.name: Dhaulagiri I
mountains.fact: Dhaulagiri I was first climbed in 1960 and is known for its massive, impressive bulk.

mountains.name: Manaslu
mountains.fact: Manaslu is known as the 'Mountain of the Spirit' and was first summited in 1956.

mountains.name: Nanga Parbat
mountains.fact: Nanga Parbat is known as the 'Killer Mountain' due to the high fatality rate among climbers attempting its summit.

mountains.name: Annapurna I
mountains.fact: Annapurna I has the highest fatality rate among the 14 eight-thousanders, with a high risk for climbers.

items.name: Skittle
items.fact: Skittles were first produced in the 1970s in the United Kingdom and have a distinctive fruity flavor.

items.name: Hot Dog
items.fact: Hot dogs, also known as frankfurters, are named after Frankfurt, Germany, where they originated.

items.name: Foot-Long Hot Dog
items.fact: The foot-long hot dog is a popular American food item, often served at sporting events and barbecues.

items.name: Matchbox Car
items.fact: Matchbox cars were first introduced in 1953 and are known for their detailed miniature models of real vehicles.

items.name: Statue of Liberty
items.fact: The Statue of Liberty was a gift from France to the United States and was dedicated on October 28, 1886.

items.name: Deepest Part of the Ocean (Mariana Trench)
items.fact: The Mariana Trench is the deepest part of the world's oceans and reaches a depth of about 11,000 meters.

items.name: 50-Inch TV (Length of Widescreen TV)
items.fact: A 50-inch TV has become a standard size for large home entertainment screens, offering a cinematic experience.

items.name: Marathon
items.fact: A marathon is a long-distance running event with a standard length of 42.195 kilometers, originating from the ancient Greek marathon run.

items.name: Ham
items.fact: Ham is a type of processed meat that comes from the hind leg of a pig and has been a staple in many cultures for centuries.

items.name: Shortest Mountain (Mount Wycheproof)
items.fact: Mount Wycheproof in Australia is considered the world's shortest mountain, with a height of just 148 meters.

items.name: Dr. Pepper Can
items.fact: A standard Dr. Pepper can holds 355 milliliters of soda and is known for its unique blend of 23 flavors.
